• Be focused, strive to solve 1-3 problems for users
  • Divide users into segment and target them with specific features that solve specific problems

• Define the problems
  • Aim to produce a simple product first, then improve upon it
  • Set the minimum required functionalities needed to solve that particular problem
  • Don't scope creep and keep adding features by delaying release
  • Create a persona that represents a target audience, think like them
  • List all possible features, then trim out those not needed to fulfill the minimum functionalities needed to solve the primary problem

• Prototype, prototype, prototype as much as possible
  • Start with feature set
  • Move on to workflow and visuals, draw wireframes
  • Prototype on a real device to get the feel right for each use case
  • Evaluate and iterate

• Minimal words
  • Maybe to a blank version of the initial view controller
  • Use colors that are also used in-app
  • Use Auto-Layout

• Complementary colors, e.g. navy with brown
  • Different colors for interactive and non-interactive elements
  • Keep it simple
  • White for empty space
One way is to change color of button title, slider and tab bar icons by calling in didFinishLaunchingWithOptions:

• Test and ask users
  • Sometimes text can be clearer
  • Include different versions of images, 1x for non-retina, 2x for retina, 3x for 5.5" large retina, App Store thins the app so no unneeded images are included in installation
  • Use vector graphics, and set Scale: Single Scale in the Attribute Inspector
  • Draw icon in balck, then set Render As: Template Imageâ€‹ to set color during runtime using the tintColor property

• Use judiciously
  • Realistic and does not defy laws of physics
  • Reversibility
  • Consistent with system animation

• Readability, mostly just use system default
  • Simplicity, use only one font is possible
  • Accessibility, listen to UIContentSizeCategoryDidChangeNotification to apply Dynamic Type setting without app restart
  • Prioritize, set text style in Attribute Inspector > Font, also decide what to change for accessibility
